intro: Microstylis calcarea, commonly known as the limestone microstylis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions with limestone soils. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, calcareous environments such as wetlands or rocky areas. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
